body: It seems the centroid of the window surfaces of a thermal zone cannot be identified correctly, and some of them are trimmed surfaces and the others are untrimmed surfaces... May I ask what might be the course of this problem and how to solve it? THanks! [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/rOQH5ikNACDgVWcjliksCsijo41UFcsNNvfCnCTkZJ0Y4LTZqZzRNhbv2o6hvuyjY9CCpwH5CgK*Yg4ZV1uo15n4KBYgNGw8/Image2.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/rOQH5ikNACCH6UuqJGweSqDgiwJZGaYBv-hs8CU*tHk-n2fe-8AgftsoP2Jej4loPDpHS2PWYvwmIxu3LbZnIoALdJrBpGt5/Image3.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/rOQH5ikNACCJlHw3GXvtlwEY3xyQf7NYIJ0GgH5YKMteAKIfDfn0skj2u4iqP8ppDEhK0myAut8dUh*JtnJCVzVVqqBiGZkY/Image4.png)
topic: unable to locate the centroid of window surface correctly

replies.body: Hi Ji, For evaluate center of the window surfaces use surface component and reparametrize that. or use area component to find center of the surfaces.[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/rOQH5ikNACD508iCjWIY8LSOelu88OR8lnes-i4BHWJnYxkGtuofuYQOWTBnbS9Es5sUmRIJbPO1309wEhnAKBWv52TRaPEV/1111.jpg)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/rOQH5ikNACCUxxiQiTX8wYyCDGQgdJH4eErLLZprxzfg*0SixwIxPzvA3u-qsxSYfMEt8V9c6pc3enRLq9UIhIfkX3Smjr55/sdddd.PNG)-Omid

Thank you very much, Omid! Good to know the reparameterize requirement to get centroid correct. I noticed that we may need to flatten the list of window surfaces if they are from different zones.
